org.zaproxy.zap.spider.parser

Interface SpiderParserListener

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SpiderController

    public interface SpiderParserListener
    The listener interface for receiving spiderParser events. The class that is interested in processing a spiderParser event implements this interface, and the object created with that class is registered with a component using the component's addSpiderParserListener method. When the spiderParser event occurs, that object's appropriate method is invoked.

    • Method Detail

      • resourceURIFound

        void resourceURIFound(HttpMessage responseMessage,
                    int depth,
                    String uri)
        Event triggered when a new resource URI is found. The responseMessage contains all the required information regarding the page which contains the URI.
        Parameters:
        responseMessage - the response message
        depth - the depth of this resource in the crawling process
        uri - the universal resource locator

      • resourceURIFound

        void resourceURIFound(HttpMessage responseMessage,
                    int depth,
                    String uri,
                    boolean shouldIgnore)
        Event triggered when a new resource URI is found. The responseMessage contains all the required information regarding the page which contains the URI.

        Also provides a shouldIgnore boolean that states that this resourceURI should be ignored in the fetching process, as it's probably a dead end (e.g. binary data, image, etc).
        Parameters:
        responseMessage - the response message
        depth - the depth of this resource in the crawling process
        uri - the universal resource locator
        shouldIgnore - whether this resource has a high chance of being not useful if fetched

      • resourcePostURIFound

        void resourcePostURIFound(HttpMessage responseMessage,
                        int depth,
                        String uri,
                        String requestBody)
        Event triggered when a new resource URI is found. However, if the URI needs to be fetched, it should be accessed with the HTTP POST method and the content of the request body message should be the one specified in messageContent.

        For example, this method can be triggered if a parser finds the uri inside a form with the method set as POST. In this case, the messageContent should contain the form data set necessary for a successful submission of the form.

        The responseMessage contains all the required information regarding the page which contains the URI.

        Parameters:
        responseMessage - the response message
        depth - the depth of this resource in the crawling process
        uri - the universal resource locator
        requestBody - represents the content that a request message should have in its body, if fetching the resource
